HomeWhat we doServices

London Supported Lodgings Service

Type of service:

Leaving care Housing and homelessness

We accept referrals from:

Young people Parents/carers

Supported Lodgings hosts are approved individuals or families who wish to provide a safe and secure home as a stepping stone for young Care Leavers aged 18-25.

By welcoming a young person into their home and providing emotional support, hosts help to prepare them for adult life. They may need support with things like finishing their education, finding longer-term accommodation and help to develop life skills such as cooking, housework and budgeting – from anywhere between eight weeks and two years.

Hosts are expertly matched with a young person and receive weekly payments, ongoing support and training from the Barnardo’s team.

All you need is a spare room and time to care.

This service sits alongside the Floating Support service as part of our London Supported Accommodation services.

Please get in touch if you are interested in becoming a Supported Lodgings host in London.

Who is this service for?

Care Leavers aged 18-25.

Who can apply for this service?

We accept referrals from:

  • Young people
  • Parents/carers

If you are a young person, you can apply to use this service using the links below.

If you are a parent/carer, you can refer a young person to this service using the links below.

Online
Fill in the online application form

Offline
Download and print the application form

If you are not in the list above you can

Accessibility

Premises are fully accessible to people with disabilites.

London Supported Lodgings Application Guidance Notes

We can help with

  • Leaving care

    • Supporting the transition to independent living, including advice, supported lodgings, help getting a job.

  • Housing and homelessness

    Housing support to assist and sustain independent living. Raising awareness through educational visits and improving the understanding of risks.

Meet the team

Clare - Project Worker

Hello my name is Clare. I'm a part-time Project Worker and I work Mondays, Thursdays and Fridays. I love walking, swimming and walking my dog. I love all things chocolate and sweets

Sue - Team Manager

Hello my name is Sue. I'm a Team Manager responsible for the running of the service. I love rock climbing and watching Netflix. I love to bake bread in my free time when I have a few minutes from doing the school runs.

Case Studies

When Jenny from Barnardo’s came along she was an absolute lifesaver. She helped with food vouchers and would go to the foodbank and collect food for us.”
